reviews.review_msg: I rated her clarity as average since this is a seminar class - the students are the one's expected to do the 'teaching', so she is merely a facilitator - though she's a good one. She is helpful, though topics tend to get a bit repetitive - essentially it's three months of talking about the memory of Nazi Germany, nothing else! Above average class.
Best looking prof in the department and has the most seductive voice around- that aside, she is clear and fair in her lectures and marking standards.

I cannot say enough about Nadine Roth. She is an amazing professor, the best in the SFU History Dept. She challenges her students, but not to the breaking point, and she is very passionate about her subject matter. Unlike some people below, I find her style (and voice!) incredibly engaging. Very open to questions and diverse opinions. Nadine rocks.
If the subject interests you take this class, although I'd recommend anything with Nadine. Even for you slackers, this should be engaging enough to get into it.

Likes to listen to himself a bit too much :-), but he's a nice guy, and his classes were really reasonable: the Zoom seminars were short and sweet, which them engaging and productive but not exhausting. Why didn't all profs at SFU do this??? Interesting material presented by somebody who cares about History. A++

Great prof, one of the best I've had at SFU.  Cares about the stuff he teaches and about his students.  Treats everybody with respect, and is totally willing to take the time to help you if you approach him.  You DO have to talk in his seminars, and you've got to have read ahead of time to do that, but he never puts you on the spot.  Great class.

I took History 401 with Dr. Lanthier in spring 2015 and found it to be a great course! The texts he assigned on Weimar Germany were relevant, and well worth keeping. Yes, it was a lot of reading, but I can say it was one of the few courses that i've taken during my degree that has really made me a better historian.
I have taken a few seminar classes with Carla and she is excellent.  Uses lots of films and extra images to keep class interesting. One of my favourite teachers because she is so personable

A great, knowledgeable professor who is clearly passionate about German history. There are a ton of course books which are unfortunately required (I had to buy around 5 books), and you MUST keep up on reading. Seminars were 3.5 hours of group discussion but it was very beneficial. Be prepared to read and talk often, but she is absolutely great.
